description: Rada Miskovic decides to leak explosive proof of historic Council abuses, passing incriminating files to trusted contacts. Word spreads quietly as citizen groups brace for major revelations.

Oksana Lintz, following Rada’s lead, discovers Halden’s hidden digital ledger showing names and data of early BCI disappearances. Journalists work quickly to verify and prepare materials for public release.
Leaked digital ledgers are published by city media, confirmed authentic by outside experts. Mass vigils and protests erupt as citizens demand accountability for BCI purges and historic abuses.
Sustained protests and sit-ins paralyze government sites. Council members publicly resign or go into hiding as families of the disappeared confront authorities.

Citizen delegations announce formation of an independent truth commission, sidelining the Council. Calls for open testimony from both current and former officials signal a new phase of public reckoning.
